content: That is an indication that it is the wrong password. If that password works when logging in online in browser, that is an indication that your email provider requires a separate password for email clients.
creator: davidsk

content: Bug reports should be directed to Mozilla's Bugzilla instance so the developers can track the issue. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org
creator: bbonacci

content:
Hi, If you have server side filters for some reason, the messages could be moved to different folders than your Inbox before arriving to your Thunderbird client. this checkbox ensures that the folder specified will be always checked for new content.

I hope that helps!
creator: shopov.bogomil

content: Bugbear, not bedbug! Old age strikes again
creator: Tombarkas

content: I would recommend using Thunderbird's built-in Import and Export tool to transfer your Thunderbird profile. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-import https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-export These support articles should assist you with instructions.
creator: bbonacci

content: You need to post information on the incoming and outgoing server settings for the account, and maybe some suggestions will be forthcoming. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: If this is IMAP, my first suggestion is to highlight account on main window, rightclick and select 'subscribe' to see if the folders appear.
creator: davidsk

content: Do you have the email still in your sent folder? Can you post a screenshot of the headers hat show the To, CC, and BCC entries?
creator: davidsk
